channel.aux_arming.text: Arm the craft, default is to also activate Idle-up

channel.aux_fpv_switch.text: Vtx Pit mode on a switch

channel.aux_horizon.text: Self levelling up to a specific angle then Acro on both Roll and Pitch, requires Level mode active

channel.aux_idle_up.text: Ensures props never stop spinning, similar to airmode, default is to use the same channel as ARM

channel.aux_levelmode.text: Accelerometer data is used to self level, needed for Racemode and Horizon

channel.aux_motor_test.text: Activate the motor test function, useful to check individual motors in the field

channel.aux_racemode.text: Uses self levelling only on the roll axis, acro on pitch, requires Level mode active

channel.aux_rssi.text: For fcs that can send rssi on a channel

channel.aux_turtle.text: Set this to ON and the fc will detect when landed inverted and activate Turtle when ARM is active, optional to set to an Aux switch

filter.dterm_dynamic_enable.text: enable a dynamic dterm filtercut, you almost always want to leave this on

motor.digital_idle.text: Adjust in small ammounts if needed to achieve smooth idle

motor.dshot_time.text: On some fcs this might need set to 300 to avoid failloops, Default 600

motor.gyro_orientation.text: Change this if the fc is mounted in a non standard way, use with the flip-gyro option until the preview model moves correctly

motor.turtle_throttle_percent.text: For whoops set to 100% larger craft start at 10% and increase by 10 to suit needs

motor_pins.text: Use this section to change motor positions, useful when using an fc in non standard configuration

motor_settings.text: Connect a lipo to access esc settings. Change direction of rotation. Not all esc are supported, Blheli-32 does not work

pid.preset.text: Select by thrust to weight ratio or props size, these presets give a safe starting point to further tune if needed

pid.profile.text: You can have 2 different sets of pids loaded in 2 profiles

receiver.bind_saved.text: Once you have bind and issued stick gesture up,up,up followed by down,down,down on Pitch this will show YES

receiver.lqi_source.text: Select the source for your rssi/lqi OSD display. Direct is best for ELRS, others can use Packet-Rate

receiver.protocol.text: Serial or spi connected rx will be detected automatically here

serial.rx.text: Enter the UART number the serial RX is connected to (for spi RX leave as NONE)

serial.smart_audio.text: Enter the UART the VTX TX line is connected to

serial_passthrough.text: Can be used to flash serial receivers via passthrough, set correct uart and Start

voltage.actual_battery_voltage.text: Default is 4.2V for normal lipo packs, set to 4.35V for HV packs

voltage.ibat_scale.text: Use the value provided by the FC manufacturer

voltage.lipo_cell_count.text: Enter the number of cells, leave at 0 to use autodetect

voltage.pid_voltage_compensation.text: Adsjusts the pids to compensate for lipo voltage drop, default ON

voltage.vbattlow.text: Set the desired voltage to trigger a warning, single cell voltage is used Default 3.3V
